name: Input
description: The Input component is an umbrella component for all inputs which share the same style as the classic text input field.

props.name: value
props.doc: The content value of the input.

props.name: align
props.doc: Defines the text alignment of the input. Can be `left`, `right` or `center`. Defaults to `left`.

props.name: label
props.doc: Prepends the Form Label component. If no ID is provided, a random ID is created.

props.name: label_sr_only
props.doc: Use `true` to make the label only readable by screen readers.

props.name: label_direction
props.doc: Use `label_direction="vertical"` to change the label layout direction. Defaults to `horizontal`.

props.name: status
props.doc: Text with a status message. The style defaults to an error message. You can use `true` to only get the status color, without a message.

props.name: status_state
props.doc: Defines the state of the status. Currently, there are two statuses `[error, info]`. Defaults to `error`.

props.name: status_props
props.doc: Use an object to define additional FormStatus properties.

props.name: globalStatus
props.doc: The [configuration](/uilib/components/global-status/properties/#configuration-object) used for the target [GlobalStatus](/uilib/components/global-status).

props.name: placeholder
props.doc: The placeholder which shows up once the input value is empty.

props.name: icon
props.doc: Icon to show before or after the input / placeholder. Can be either a string defining a primary icon or a Component using an SVG icon of either 16px or 24px.

props.name: icon_position
props.doc: Defines the position of icon inside the input. Set to `left` or `right`. Defaults to `left` if not set.

props.name: icon_size
props.doc: The icon size of the icon shows. Defaults to `medium`.

props.name: keep_placeholder
props.doc: Set to `true` in case the `placeholder` has to be kept during focus. By default, the placeholder disappears on focus.

props.name: input_class
props.doc: In case we have to set a custom input class.

props.name: type
props.doc: Choose between `text`, `number`, `email`, `password`, `url`, `tel` and `search`.

props.name: autocomplete
props.doc: Defaults to `off`. Set to `on` or any of [allowed `attributes`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-autocomplete). Keep in mind, 1. you may have to define a `name`, 2. have the input as a descendant of a `<form>` element, 3. and have a submit button inside the form.

props.name: submit_button_title
props.doc: Title attribute for the search/submit button. Only relevant when `type="search"`.

props.name: suffix
props.doc: Text describing the content of the input more than the label. you can also send in a React component, so it gets wrapped inside the Input component.

props.name: size
props.doc: The sizes you can choose is `default` (2rem), `medium` (2.5rem) and `large` (3rem) are supported component sizes. Defaults to `default` / `null`. Also, if you define a number like `size={2}` then it will be forwarded as the input element attribute.

props.name: selectall
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the whole input value gets selected on the entry focus. A second click will place the cursor on the wanted position.

props.name: clear
props.doc: If set to `true`, then a clear button will be shown which lets the user clear any given input value.

props.name: stretch
props.doc: If set to `true`, then the input field will be 100% in `width`.

props.name: skeleton
props.doc: If set to `true`, an overlaying skeleton with animation will be shown.

props.name: input_attributes
props.doc: Provide the Input element with any attributes by using an Object `input_attributes={{size:'2'}}` or a JSON Object `input_attributes='{"size":"2"}'`. **NB:** Keep in mind, that also every not listed component property will be sent along and set as an Input element attribute.

props.name: input_state
props.doc: Defines a custom visual state of the input. Use it only if you have to simulate a custom state. Currently are three statuses `virgin` , `focus` and `dirty`. Defaults to `null`.

props.name: submit_element
props.doc: Accepts a React element which will show up like the "submit button" would do on `type="search"`.

props.name: inner_ref
props.doc: By providing a React.ref we can get the internally used input element (DOM). E.g. `inner_ref={myRef}` by using `React.createRef()` or `React.useRef()`.

props.name: input_element
props.doc: By providing a new component we can change the internally used element. Also supports a string only, like `input_element="input"`.

props.name: inner_element
props.doc: By providing a new component to be rendered inside the "shell" â€“ we can add a freely customizable internal element. Used by the Autocomplete component.

events.name: on_change
events.doc: Will be called on value changes made by the user. Returns an object with the value as a string and the native event: `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_focus
events.doc: Will be called on focus set by the user. Returns `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_key_down
events.doc: Will be called on key down by the user. Returns `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_blur
events.doc: Will be called on blur set by the user. Returns `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_submit
events.doc: Will be called on enter key press or submit button click. Returns `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_submit_focus
events.doc: Will be called on submit button focus. Only relevant when `type="search"`. Returns `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_submit_blur
events.doc: Will be called on submit button blur. Only relevant when `type="search"`. Returns `{ value, event }`.

events.name: on_clear
events.doc: Will be called on a clear button click. Returns `{ value, previousValue, event }`.
